conclusion: Goal is to determine whether Car A is ahead or behind Car B at t = 10 s, given they are side by side at t = 30 s.
Car A's velocity is constant at 40 m/s from t = 0 s to t = 30 s, then drops to 0 m/s after t = 30 s.
Car B's velocity increases linearly from 0 m/s at t = 0 s to 40 m/s at t = 30 s.
The area under a v-t graph represents the displacement of the car.
Car B's velocity function is v_B(t) = (4/3)t for 0 <= t <= 30.
Car A's displacement from t = 0 to t = 30 is 1200 m.
Car B's displacement from t = 0 to t = 30 is 600 m.
Car B starts 600 m ahead of Car A at t = 0 s.
Car A's displacement from t = 0 to t = 10 is 400 m.
Car B's displacement from t = 0 to t = 10 is approximately 66.67 m.
Car A's position at t = 10 is 400 m.
Car B's position at t = 10 is 666.67 m.
Car B is ahead of Car A at t = 10 s.
At t = 10 s, Car A is behind Car B.
